vote.title: To honor, recognize and celebrate the life of Robert Yance “Bob” Farrington Sr.
vote.description:
Title
 
To honor, recognize and celebrate the life of Robert Yance “Bob” Farrington Sr.
 
Body
 
WHEREAS, Robert Yance “Bob” Farrington Sr., known affectionately as “Fuzzy”, aged 88 of Columbus, Ohio, passed away at home surrounded by his loving family on Saturday, February 8, 2025; and 
 
WHEREAS, born August 26, 1936 in Columbus, Ohio, he was the son of the late William Hugh and Grace Elizabeth Farrington; and 
 
WHEREAS, an electrician by trade, Mr. Farrington was a pillar of trade and labor unions in the state of Ohio. He was a proud member of I.B.E.W. Local 683 starting in 1957, serving as Vice President from 1972-1975 and as a Business Agent from 1973-1974; and 
 
WHEREAS, he also served as President of the Ohio State Building and Construction Trades Training Foundation, Executive Secretary Emeritus of the Ohio State Building and Construction Trades Council, Vice President of the Ohio AFL-CIO, Chairman of the Construction Safety Committee of the National Safety Council, and President of the Board of the Columbus Public Library Board of Trustees, along with several other positions; and
 
WHEREAS, Mr. Farrington was a recipient of the Department of Labor-Bureau of Apprenticeship Training Award for Meritorious Service, the George Meany Award for Community Service, the Distinguished Service Award from the Ohio Council of Vocational Education, along with various other awards and recognitions; and
 
WHEREAS, Mr. Farrington is survived by his daughter, Lisa Ann Farrington of Columbus, Ohio; sons, Robert Yance (Nell) Farrington Jr. of South Carolina, and Christopher Patrick (Laura) Farrington of Columbus, Ohio; eleven grandchildren, Joel (Ashlea), Lyndsey, Keeley, David, Anthony, Jennifer, Lisa, CJ, Mackenzie (Bradley), Destanie, and Logan; and sixteen great-grandchildren; and
 
WHEREAS, besides his parents, Mr. Farrington was preceded in death by his beloved wife, Geneva B. “Genny” (Rodgers) Farrington (2012); son, Gregory Hugh Farrington; and twin brother, William Hugh Farrington; and
 
WHEREAS, Mr. Farrington showed unwavering dedication to the labor movement, making significant contributions to the improvement of the lives of workers in the City of Columbus and the state of Ohio; now, therefore 
 
BE IT RESOLVED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS: 
That this Council does hereby honor, recognize, and celebrate the life of Robert “Bob” Yance Farrington Sr. and extends our sincerest condolences to his family and friends.
